content:
The North American Telugu Society (NATS) conducts various events throughout the year to serve and engage the Telugu community in the US. Some of the events include:

1. Bi-Annual Conventions: NATS holds a bi-annual 3-day convention to celebrate Telugu culture and heritage with thousands of attendees. The convention includes cultural, literary, and business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing education classes, women's forums, and career development programs.
2. Million Can Drive: NATS organizes a Million Can Drive every year across the US to collect food items for local food banks and shelters.
3. Cultural programs: NATS promotes Telugu cultural heritage by conducting classical dance and music programs, folk arts and theater performances.
4. Educational programs: NATS conducts seminars, workshops, and training programs on various topics such as financial planning, career development, and health and wellness.
5. Community service: NATS is involved in various community service activities, including volunteering at local shelters, food banks, and schools.
6. Sports and recreation: NATS organizes sports events such as cricket tournaments, outdoor activities, and cultural games to promote healthy living and encourage community building.

These events provide a platform for Telugu people living in North America to connect, engage, and celebrate their culture and heritage.
